paragraphs.body: A tribal chief, also known as a chieftain, is the leader of a tribal society. A chiefdom is the form of government in the ${link_0} and ancient ${link_1}, and appears in certain clan groups in the ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: A tribal chief, also known as a chieftain, is the leader of a tribal society. A chiefdom is the form of government in the Water Tribe and ancient Sun Warrior civilization, and appears in certain clan groups in the Earth Kingdom.

paragraphs.body: The head of the Water Tribe government bears the title chief. Both tribes were governed by the chief of the ${link_0}; the ${link_1}, founded as a colony by northern settlers, was not governed by a separate ruler. The chief is assisted in making decisions by a small council of notables, such as the waterbending master ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: The head of the Water Tribe government bears the title chief. Both tribes were governed by the chief of the Northern Water Tribe; the Southern Water Tribe, founded as a colony by northern settlers, was not governed by a separate ruler. The chief is assisted in making decisions by a small council of notables, such as the waterbending master Pakku.

paragraphs.body: The position of chief is hereditary and conveys significant social prestige. The Northern Water Tribe gave the sons and daughters of the chief the title of prince or ${link_0}. Prior to the ${link_1}, there were frequent marriages between the royal family and prominent southern clans: however, the disruption of the war and the isolation of the south led to the tribes drifting further apart, and the chief's actual role in the south was reduced to little more than a figurehead.
paragraphs.text: The position of chief is hereditary and conveys significant social prestige. The Northern Water Tribe gave the sons and daughters of the chief the title of prince or princess. Prior to the Hundred Year War, there were frequent marriages between the royal family and prominent southern clans: however, the disruption of the war and the isolation of the south led to the tribes drifting further apart, and the chief's actual role in the south was reduced to little more than a figurehead.

paragraphs.body: The title "chief" is sometimes used for local leaders such as ${link_0} in the context of the Southern Tribe; however, this is an informal title of respect and does not imply similar power due to the more egalitarian nature of southern society. Decisions in the south are made by a of Council of Elders comprising the most respected members of the southern community.
paragraphs.text: The title "chief" is sometimes used for local leaders such as Hakoda in the context of the Southern Tribe; however, this is an informal title of respect and does not imply similar power due to the more egalitarian nature of southern society. Decisions in the south are made by a of Council of Elders comprising the most respected members of the southern community.

paragraphs.body: By 171 ${link_0}, ${link_1} had become chief of the Water Tribes after having his elder brother, ${link_2}, banished for destroying a sacred forest. As part of his drive for centralization, he attempted to increase his control over the mostly autonomous south, leading to the beginning of a ${link_3}. However, after Unalaq was killed during ${link_4}, the Southern Water Tribe became independent, with Tonraq as the newly elected chief. Unalaq's children, ${link_5}, took over the Northern chiefdom.
paragraphs.text: By 171 AG, Unalaq had become chief of the Water Tribes after having his elder brother, Tonraq, banished for destroying a sacred forest. As part of his drive for centralization, he attempted to increase his control over the mostly autonomous south, leading to the beginning of a civil war. However, after Unalaq was killed during Harmonic Convergence, the Southern Water Tribe became independent, with Tonraq as the newly elected chief. Unalaq's children, Desna and Eska, took over the Northern chiefdom.

paragraphs.body: Certain Earth Kingdom tribes and clans, such as the ${link_0} and ${link_1}, elect members of their community to act as their chiefs. These chiefs typically make important decisions for the groups and serve as repositories of tribal lore. The term is also used to refer to the leaders of the small, primitive tribes located in the northwestern river marshes of the kingdom.
paragraphs.text: Certain Earth Kingdom tribes and clans, such as the Gan Jin and Zhang, elect members of their community to act as their chiefs. These chiefs typically make important decisions for the groups and serve as repositories of tribal lore. The term is also used to refer to the leaders of the small, primitive tribes located in the northwestern river marshes of the kingdom.

paragraphs.body: The Sun Warrior civilization, long believed extinct, was likewise led by a chief of considerable importance, though with the decline of the culture the chief's power likewise waned.
paragraphs.text: The Sun Warrior civilization, long believed extinct, was likewise led by a chief of considerable importance, though with the decline of the culture the chief's power likewise waned.
